title: Quiz 3: Admission, Legal & Nursing Principles
topicName: Unit 1: Mental Health and Psychiatric Nursing
description: Test on the Mental Health Act, admission procedures, and key nursing principles.

questions.question: Which section of the Mental Health Act (MHA) deals with Voluntary Patients?
To admit an involuntary patient, Form MOH ___BLANK___ must be filled by a relative, and Form MOH ___BLANK___ by a doctor.
questions.explanation: MOH 614 is the application (relative); MOH 615 is the medical recommendation.
questions.hint: They are sequential numbers starting after the voluntary form (613).

questions.question: Under the Mental Health Act, who can arrest a person found to be dangerous to themselves or others for emergency admission? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Police officers, Chiefs, or Assistant Chiefs have this authority under Part VII.
questions.hint: Think of law enforcement and administration.

questions.question: An emergency admission patient must be reviewed after 72 hours.
questions.explanation: The act requires review after 72 hours to determine if the patient is of sound mind or needs further admission.

questions.question: Match the nursing principle to its description:

pairs.right: Putting yourself in another's shoes while remaining detached.
Being answerable for actions; crucial due to patient vulnerability.
Being comfortable, flexible, and not overly formal.
Recognizing how one's own behavior affects others.

questions.question: How long is the initial admission period for an involuntary patient under Part VI of the MHA?
questions.explanation: Involuntary patients are admitted for a period of not more than six months initially.

questions.question: Which MHA section makes it an offence for a non-medical practitioner to sign certificates?
questions.explanation: Section 47 prohibits non-practitioners from signing medical certificates.
questions.hint: It's the first offence listed in Part XIV.

questions.question: Which of the following are members of the Kenya Board of Mental Health? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The board includes DMS, Psychiatrist, Clinical Officer, Nurse, Social Services, Education, and provincial reps.
questions.hint: Think health, social services, and education.

questions.question: Order the steps for admitting a voluntary patient over 16 years old:

items.text: Patient desires to submit to treatment.
Patient makes written application to person in charge.
Patient fills Form MOH 613 in duplicate.

questions.question: Forms for involuntary admission must reach the hospital within ___BLANK___ days of signing, otherwise they become invalid.
